result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Dean Lepak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/21/22 by 4:00 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Home Depot.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/21/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Dean Lepak

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Dean Lepak in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jason Dean Lepak.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/21/22 by 4:00 pm.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with Home Depot.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/21/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jason Dean Lepak in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jason Dean Lepak.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Court granted defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Dean Lepak in court.  Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Tom Potter who is available by phone.Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 9/14/2022 at 8:30 am, Branch 1 
Court leaves previously posted bail as it.
Court terminates JusticePoint supervision.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a Status Conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance. 
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner, and no action on bail.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 05-27-2022, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Violation Report 05-23-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jason Dean Lepak in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant was not qualified for a SPD but has lost his job.  Court ordered the defendant to contact the SPD office to see if he qualifies now.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Home Depot location.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Jason Dean Lepak in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jason Dean Lepak in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Dean Lepak appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
